description.narrative: Solidaridad developed the Sustainable Cotton Ranking in close cooperation with Pesticides Action Network UK and WWF International. The report created massive online publicity in cotton and textiles media all over the world (potential reach 17 million worldwide). Companies in the top of the ranking have used their scores to publicly highlight their achievements and therewith promote the use of sustainable cotton, by showing that it is possible to make and keep commitments. Solidaridad participated as council (board) member of the Better Cotton Initiative in the design of the new strategy. We advocated for a more farmer-centric approach and the inclusion of a specific gender strategy including more attention for impact measurement. This contributed, among others, to a first time president from the producer constituency and the allocation of more funds for gender impact measurement. Furthermore Solidaridad maintained its network with relevant initiatives like the Textile Exchange, Organic Cotton Roundtable and Cotton 2040 Organic Cotton Accelerator. Together with the Pesticide Action network and WWF, Solidaridad coordinated the publication of the 3rd Sustainable Cotton ranking (published in February 2020).
